title: Implications of Gender-Affirming Hormone Therapy for Psychosocial Functioning and Social Relationships of Transgender People
descriptions:
This grant proposal seeks to investigate the impact of Gender-Affirming Hormone Therapy (GAHT) on the psychosocial functioning and social relationships of transgender individuals. The project will focus on the Transgender health research area, specifically addressing key concerns related to psychosocial functioning and social relationship experiences. The population of interest is transgender people, who face high rates of social disruption and suicide risk.

Using a biopsychosocial model, the research will employ a variety of novel and cutting-edge methods across four work packages to achieve its aims. These aims include isolating causal pathways between GAHT and psychosocial functioning, empowering transgender individuals to share their personal and relational experiences, and informing policy and practice in gender identity services.

The project will adhere to an informed consent model and prioritize outcomes related to improvements in psychosocial functioning and social relationship outcomes. By positioning itself at the forefront of gender-affirming healthcare research, this proposal seeks to contribute valuable insights that can enhance the well-being and quality of life of transgender individuals.
